alert.note: Alert for Albany; Carbon (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 12 at 3:06PM MST until January 12 at 3:45PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... East central Carbon County in south central Wyoming... Central Albany County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 345 PM MST. * At 306 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Rock River to near Bosler, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions with near zero visibility associated with intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 50 mph could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 264 and 287. Locations impacted include... Rock River, Bosler, Wheatland Reservoir 3, Arlington, Garrett, and Baldy Peak. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
